headline: Whole Wheat Banana Nut Bread
description: This is a very moist, honey-sweetened loaf with only nuts and a splash of vanilla to heighten the rich fruitiness.

video.description: This rich, hearty loaf is great for breakfast or snacks.
video.name: Whole Wheat Banana Nut Bread

name: Whole Wheat Banana Nut Bread

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Grease a 9x5-inch loaf pan.

In a large bowl, beat oil and honey together. Add eggs, and mix well. Stir in bananas and vanilla. Stir in flour and salt. Add baking soda to hot water, stir to mix, and then add to batter. Blend in chopped nuts. Spread batter into prepared pan.
Bake until a toothpick inserted in the center of the loaf comes out clean, 55 to 60 minutes. Cool on wire rack for 1/2 hour before slicing.

review.reviewBody: I added sun flowers seeds. So so good..

My kids love this recipe as it is more salty than sweet.. They don't like too much sweet dishes. From the 1st time, my friend introduced this recipe, it became a big favourite. My kids don't like ripe bananas, walnut or honey but when mixed in this wonderful batter.. They gobble it in a single dayðŸ˜ƒ
My old recipe is much better, this might be more nutritious but not fond of the flavor, I will make my old recipe before I make this again.

I baked the bread as cup cakes for 30 minutes. I did add chocolate chips. Next time I will not. But the bread was still taste. I just think the chocolate chips took the true flavor away. I also fund the bread became more flavorful after a day or two after baking.

Loved this recipe! I used vanilla yogurt because thatâ€™s what I had I also used vegetable oil because I didnâ€™t have coconut oil I wish I would have thought about using applesauce instead. But it came out amazing anyway.
very simple recipe I'm about to make it again in fact today I'm doing it

Not sweet enough. Cooking time is totally incorrect. Should be 300 degrees for that amount of time. Bread turned out crisp on the edges and gooey In The middle. Very little flavor. Needed probably 1.5 times the amount t of banana and added sweetener. Maybe cinnamon? Super bland. Not impressed at all.

Very Good I also added a little more spice Cinnamon, nutmeg and cloves More vanilla and bananas Very moist Very good I like her tips on applesauce instead of oil I will use next time and freezing bananas for bread use

This is my new Banana Bread favorite. I used 1 and 1/2 bananas, substituted with Cocoa Covered Almonds instead of Walnuts and used 4 ounces of applesauce rather than oil. Very moist. Very Delicious!! I've made 2 loaves in the last week. My Mom asked me to make it again and add zucchini, I will be trying that soon.
I am not a baker but found this recipe to be simple and easy to follow. We love it. I have also added blueberries and pumpkin seeds on occasion.
Followed Seattlecookâ€™s recommendations and it came out wonderfully moist, just the right amount of sweetness and satisfying, besides making my house smell heavenly
Came out pretty good.

Very tasty cake; went down well with the fam such that I will be baking again next week. I think my oven was too hot...browned quite quickly. Used honey, no sugar - tasted sweet without artificial sugar taste. I suggest having a lower temp for the banana to actually dry inside. High heat = dried top/burnt crust with a wet inside.

This is delicious! I made it with my daughter, which was fun! We didnâ€™t have any vanilla extract, so we added 1/2 teaspoon of cinnamon and 1/2 teaspoon of nutmeg instead. We also sprinkled chocolate chips on the top and didnâ€™t use the walnuts. Everything else was exactly as the recipe says, and it is a hit!

I used olive oil instead of vegetable oil & egg whites instead of eggs. I topped it with chopped walnuts & sprinkled with brown sugar before baking. Will absolutely bake this again! It is super moist, not too sweet & delicious!!
Delicious and easy to make
They turned out well. I made muffins, rather than one loaf. I added some chopped pecans as well.
*4/8/20: I subbed applesauce for the oil, and I used 3 old bananas. I would add some extra spice next time and perhaps use a bit of brown sugar. Still a solid recipe.

I used melted coconut oil instead of vegetable oil, reduced the honey to 1/4 cup and added 1/4 cup of applesauce. I divided the mixture into silicone muffin liners and baked for 25 minutes at 350 F. My kids love them. :)
Simple and tasty
This is very good. It does taste healthy, more of a wheat bread with a hint of banana. My kids really likes it which speaks volumes.
very good
Easy and not bad for whole wheat flour. I used Bob's Red Mill stone ground wheat. I came out very moist and delicious.

I made it exactly like the recipe and directions as written, and baked for exactly 60 minutes. It was way too dry. It also wasnâ€™t even that it wasnâ€™t sweet enough; it wasnâ€™t sweet at all. And my bananas were very sweet.
Will make again. Just found with the whole wheat flour it was a little gritty tasting. Otherwise was moist and delicious.
Didnâ€™t change a thing and my husband loved it. Moist and delicious! Healthier and better banana bread. Would never know it didnâ€™t have any sugar in it. Amazing!
Made exactly per directions, sans nuts. Very surprised at the rise on it. The most light and well-textured banana bread I've ever had. Not surgary sweet, just sweet enough, great flavor.
Good recipe, might have needed some more sugar. Goes good with natural peanut butter

Followed the recipe exactly and it came out perfect. Not too sweet, and you can't tell it's made with whole wheat flour! I only had just under a cup of mashed bananas, but that didn't really affect the flavour too much. Next time I will try adding an extra banana :)

Found I didn't have baking soda so used baking powder and didn't add the extra 1/4 c of water - and I should've! Loved the taste, but it was too heavy because of no water! I cooked it in a crockpot, and that worked well - I will definitely correct the water next time, because I will make again - I enjoy whole wheat flour in breads, so thanks for the recipe!
Very easy and delicious. Moist.
Yummy! Fantastic recipe, made with honey instead of sugar and whole wheat flour instead of processed white flour. Besides being very moist and tasty, it's pretty healthy!
This recipe is very weak on banana. I couldnâ€™t even taste it.
Used coconut oil instead of veg oil, milk instead of water, some oat flour plus whole wheat. Added chocolate chips. Was fabulous. Will definitely make again and again.
Best thing I ever baked so far. I followed the recipe to the letter and was not disappointed.
I made it I add blueberries and it was great . Love it
Used this recipe to make Banana blueberry Muffins. I just left out the nuts, added about a cup of blueberries, and baked for 25 minutes at 325 in a muffin tin. (Makes 12)
Used a half mashed banana for each egg to make it dairy-free. Doubled the nuts and added a splash of almond extract. Best bread I've made to date!
Turned out great! For oil I use coconut oil and sweetner I used agave. Next time I'm going to try adding raisins.

This is a great recipe for whole wheat banana bread! I substituted another banana for the two eggs, and added a couple of tablespoons of white sugar. After pouring the batter in your pan, sprinkle a generous amount of brown sugar on top of the loaf before you bake it! This makes the top extra sweet and crunchy. Delicious and nutritious! Love it! I've made it twice so far but I have a feeling it's going to become a regular, memorized recipe!

I made this recipe following the directions except I substituted molasses for the honey and used a little more mashed banana and also used 1/2 tsp baking powder so it would be lighter. It was fantastic! Usually my banana bread comes out too dense and heavy. This was light in texture and dark in color because of the molasses. Good recipe!
Excellent recipe. I also added 3 tablespoons of hemp and 1/4 teaspoon of ground cloves and cinnamon plus 1/2 cup more of bananas for moist. Yummy!
Followed the recipe, using applesauce instead of oil. Sprinkled a few chocolate chips on top, too! It was delicious!
Best Banana bread and its so easy !

Awesome recipe!! Just a few changes to make it more moist & flavorful.. I used 1/2 cup olive oil and 1/2 cup honey to 1 cup whole wheat flour. I also added cinnamon to pep up the flavor. Boy... was it not amazing!! My hubby and kid loved it.. it was amazingly soft and moist... could hardly believe that this could also be so healthy!!

I made this using the reviews and as suggested used a mix of brown sugar and honey as well as the apple sauce. This ended up being way to sweet for me and will try with the oil next time. With all these sugars in the recipe I don't think it is very healthy especially for those who have to watch their intake. Using something like canola oil is much healthier and will add only a few more calories. Not happy but will try recipe again using the oil.

I like using applesauce in place of oil, but this time I used 1/2 oil and 1/2 applesauce. I used the 1/4 of honey and only about 1/8 cup of brown sugar (because that was all I had), but next time I will only go with the 1/8 cup of honey. I, also, used half as much salt as called for. Definitely will make again.

I substituted apple sauce for the oil, egg whites for the whole eggs, added 1/2 t. cinnamon, one large grated carrot and a third of a cup of chocolate chips. I baked it 52 minutes at 325 degrees. Delicious!
LOVE it just as the recipe is written, I'd love to test out the applesauce version though!!

I used a 3rd less wheat flour and replaced it with oats, I used a quarter less honey and replaced it with brown sugar. I added Ghirardelli's semi sweet chocolate chips, coconut and chopped almonds because that's what I had on hand. I realize I changed alot in the recipe but I still give 5 stars bc it was an easy and good base recipe for me. I'll try coconut oil instead of veg next time as I enjoy the flavor it gives to baked goods.

I was concerned the whole wheat flour would result in a dry texture, but it was moist and the flavor was incredible. I substituted olive oil, added cinnamon, nutmeg and a bit more nuts. This will be my go to recipe for banana nut bread!
My parents absolutely love this recipe! I made this twice already. Very healthy too.
This is the best banana bread I have made and I love that it uses 100% whole wheat. It rises, it is moist, it is very flavorful. I did add 1/2 tsp of cinnamon, and used bananas from my backyard.
Not too sweet but moist and delicious.
Really delicious! I used applesauce in place of oil as others suggested. Very moist ! Next time maybe I would add more walnuts and a handful of dark chocolate chips just because!
Super easy and quick! Sometimes I only do half the amount of honey and then I add a little raw sugar. It's delicious! I recommend using medium to dark brown bananas for a sweeter taste.

This was so delicious!! I actually substituted the honey with pure maple syrup and it was really good! My husband couldn't tell it was whole wheat either. I made a banana bread that was whole wheat once and you could tell. This was also very moist!! I will be using this recipe again!
I made muffins out of the recipe. Instead of egg, I used unsweetened applesauce. Baked at regular temp but for 28 minutes. Turned out perfectly sweet and moist. Thanks!

Last night i made this recipe, exactly lie this on, and it was perfect. it was moist, not too sweet, just like it shoulb be. 
and it was perfect for my low calorie diet.
I made this bread and its truly amazing
This was very good banana bread. I made it with olive oil, and almost 2 cups of bananas. Next time I'm going to try coconut oil.
Made this and used EVOO instead of vegetable oil. Worked great still and tasted great!!

Bread was moist, but needs more banana flavor. Adding more banana may also solve the issue of the lack of sweetness in the bread. It just was too healthy. Maybe it will go good with some jam and butter?

Loved the yummy moist bread. I made 2 changes to the recipe 1) I replaced the honey with an equivalent quantity of dark brown sugar and 2) Added mixed chopped nuts (walnuts, pecans, almonds, pumpkin seeds) for extra crunch and flavor. Would definitely make this again!

Delicious!!! I don't like bananas, but this looked so good. I used two bananas and used applesauce to fill up the two cups. I also split the amount of oil with applesauce, half and half, and added a half teaspoon of nutmeg (per reviews). What a hearty, delicious, and nutritious bread! Thank you for the post!

This is an excellent banana bread. I was looking for a recipe with whole wheat flour, and I'm really happy with how it turned out--as was anyone else who tried it! I baked this in one 8" loaf pan and it was done in 1 hour 15 minutes.

Super easy to make and DELICIOUS! I added 1/4 cup leftover pumpkin puree and subbed 1/4 apple sauce for oil. I used 1/4 cup honey and added 1/4 cup chocolate chips. Also added 6/8 teaspoons cinnamon and nutmeg. Amazing!
I used coconut oil instead and it turned out so fantastic!! Also I used egg whites because I can't eat eggs. Oh and extra walnuts. I'll be making this again for sure!
Great recipe! Left the nuts out for personal preference but otherwise followed the recipe exactly and it turned out moist and very tasty. Will definitely be doing this again.
This was better than expect considering the wheat flour. I used others suggestions and added cinnamon and chocolate chips. Turned out very moist.

Delicious! I used olive oil instead of vegetable oil and I also added large dashes of cinnamon. And instead of 1 c of bananas, I bumped it up to nearly 2. Very delicious and healthy bread. Plus my very picky 3 and 7 year olds loved it!
Delicious, moist and easy. I did add a tsp of pumpkin pie spice as suggested by a previous review. This is my go-to recipe for banana bread now!

Great recipe! It has outdone my expectations. Love the more natural ingredients versus other recipes I've seen (no butter or processed sugars) and even though I made it several days ago it has remained moist and has not dried out. I left out the nuts as this was shared beyond my use (allergy concerns),but will add them in the future.This will be my go to banana bread going forward. Absolutely love it! Thank you to the person who shared this! :)
I used half cup of blue Agave sweetener instead of honey and it came out very well.

Of course I made changes. It's always fun to make changes and based on other reviews it sounded like it needed more moisture and spices, so thanks for that advice. I used organic grass fed butter instead of oil. I added an additional 1/2 cup of (1) banana. Instead of the 1/2 cup honey I used 3 TBS fructose and 1/4 cup honey to reduce the glycemic index. I love cinnamon so I added at least 1 Tbs along with a pinch of ground clove and nutmeg. I also used more nuts; a mix of 1/2 cup walnuts and 1/2 cup pecans. It was amazing!! This was very moist and made good sized loaf in a 9" loaf pan. I cut into slices and froze most of it so that I don't eat it all in one day. It froze very well with the thawed pieces tasting just as fresh as the day it was made. I will definitely do this one again.

I've made this recipe twice. The first time as a loaf, exactly as the recipe was written. It was great! The second time I read some other reviews and decided to try some of the suggestions. I replaced the oil with prune/Apple purÃ©ed baby food. I also added 1tsp cinnamon and 1/2 tsp nutmeg. I baked them in muffin tins for closer to 35-40 minutes. The texture is better and they are so moist.

I love this bread! 
I did try a few modifications - added 1/4 tsp each of ground black pepper, clove powder, cinnamon powder, and , sometimes have tried adding dried ginger powder and it tastes great!
I sometimes forget to keep the baking soda separate, and add it to flour/dry ingredients , and then add hot water in the end. The results are still great, turns out fine even with that .

I've been purposely looking for recipes that leave out refined sugar. This is a really good one. I even went ahead and substituted coconut oil for the vegetable oil and it worked great! Good. Sweet enough. Moist. I had a youngster request I add chocolate chips. To keep that addition minimal, I baked this for 30 minutes in a 9x13 cake pan and sprinkled just a few chips on top of "cake" fresh out of warm oven. Then I spread the chips when melted for a nice, thin layer of chocolatey goodness.
Delicious. I added semisweet bakers chocolate and my daughter loved it.
I cheated a little bit - used 3 eggs and peanut butter chips! It was super moist and I was happy that I didn't have to use ground sugar to get my desired level of sweetness!

Its great, but I use about a 1/2 cup oil, and use about 3/4 cup banana. I go over the top with the honey, and I add a few handfuls of shredded cocoanut and about 4 handfuls of dark chocolate chips. It becomes super moist, and the banana, cocoanut and dark chocolate works well together. Sprinkled with a lot of cinnamon/sugar on the top before baking for a sugar coat crust.

By far the BEST banana bread recipe I've ever encountered, as it made the BEST banana bread ever! I added 1 tsp of cinnamon and 1/4 tsp of nutmeg and the taste was wonderful and consistancy perfection. I used raw YS honey, extra virgin olive oil, and for my salt I grated Himalayan pink salt with a pinch of celtic sea salt. WOW. Thank you for posting this amazing recipe, I will never use another.

The only substitution I made was simply due to the fact that I have two huge gallon bags of pecans, but I have no doubt that walnuts would be terrific in this bread. I admit that I couldn't wait and cut into it an hour after it came out of the oven. It's been my experience that banana breads are best a day after baking. This was already moist and its flavor can only improve. Whoever posted that it has a horrible aftertaste must have used a rancid ingredient or mismeasured.

Yay - finally a recipe that's healthy and so tasty!!! I made just a couple minor changes - I used applesauce instead of the oil and just a little bit of brown sugar (less than 1/4 of a cup) as another reviewer recommended). I also used about 1 1/4 c mashed bananas (about 3 large), and sprinkled in some mini chocolate chips. It was so moist and flavorful. Definitely a recipe we will make often!

After reading some of the reviews I decided to try this recipe, with my own variations. I went half and half with white and wheat flour, half and half with brown sugar and agave, and sprinkled a couple of raisins and chocolate chips in. I also used two large bananas, didn't measure them. It was fabulous! Next time I'll lessen the brown sugar from 1/4 cup to a table spoon as we are working on lessening our sugar intake.

Very good recipe; however, I would, like other reviewers have mentioned, increase the banana a bit and add spices to enhance the flavor. The main issue I ran into was the baking time- the batter is wet! 1/4 cup water may be too much.. but seeing that only a handful of other reviewers mention extending the baking time, I wonder if the issue is more a result of the altitude of where I live (a little over a mile up.) I had to knock the temperature down to 300 (and then lower to keep from burning) after the first hour and bake for another 1 1/2 hours! I will certainly make the recipe again, but I think I will try muffins or use a flatter dish next time (which would give me banana bars instead of a loaf.)

This was a great recipe! I did adjust as others suggested using apple sauce instead of the oil, and it worked out great! I did need to cook about 6-7 minutes longer than the recipe called for. This is much healthier version of banana nut bread, and it's moist and delicious! This will be my go-to banana nut bread recipe going forward.

Love that this is made with whole wheat. Very easy, moist and delicious. My only change was adding more than 1 cup mashed bananas because I happened to have more than the recipe called for and it still turned out great. Thank you for sharing!
Made it a few times, went for olive oil instead of vegetable and it came out brilliantly. Staple recipe.
Very bland, needs a lot more banana flavor, the wheat flour over powers it.
Best banana bread I used less oil and honey still just fine.

This is a delicious bread.I did make a few changes but this made the bread super delicious,I used 1/2 cup ground flaxseed and 1 1/4 cup wheat flour,1/2 tsp of cinnamon powder and 1/4 tsp nutmeg, 1/4 cup butter and 3tbsp of olive oil,1/4 cup brown sugar and 1/2 cup honey,4tbsp of plain yogurt and had no walnuts so used 1-cup of raisins and 1/4 cup pumpkin seeds forgot to add the baking soda to the hot water so added the hot water to the honey.fowwed the directions on mixing the batter and baked for 45 mins on 325 degrees F but center was raw so baked 20 mins on 225 degrees F and results are delicious,I have eaten up 2 slices already!!!well I have eaten several slices now! Must must make cake ... Yummy
Great recipe for a person like me who tries to make sweet treats healthier. I just added extra bananas n it turned out amazing!!! Thanks, this is definitely a keeper :)

I added a dash of cinnamon and I just took it out of the oven... I'm worried it won't be sweet enough because the honey I used is raw organic honey... Waiting to try it after it cools down! It was super easy to make and def looks and smells great!
Made it with four bananas and it came out great!

Made this as muffins. They were delicious but have to give only four stars because I made some substitutions and don't think they would be quite so delicious without the alterations. I used 1/3 of a cup of coconut oil. ( I love baking with this oil best light and fluffy muffins because it's not as heavy as most oils) I also used an extra 1/2 cup of bananas. As well as a teaspoon of pumpkin pie spice added flavor but wasnt too spiced. I then baked these for 12-15 min in a muffin pan lightly greased with nonstick cooking spray. Amazing! :)

I doubled this recipe and it made two loaves perfectly. I used applesauce instead of oil and I used the amount of banana listed (put through blender) and then cut up an extra banana to have some chunks in it. It is very good, the only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is it is a little bland. I think adding even more banana would solve that problem.

This recipe was delicious! I was looking for a healthy alternative to my mom's wonderfully decedent banana bread recipe (that's totally not healthy) and I think I've found it. I have made it 3 times so far. The first time I made it exactly as the recipe indicated, then I experimented after that. I added 2 packets of maple brown sugar instant oatmeal and about a tablespoon of cinnamon to the batter and replaced the oil with applesauce. The oatmeal added a great texture to the bread, although it makes it more dense. My husband gobbles it up!

I have tried the recipe and it turned out great!
I replaced the walnuts with dried blueberries and some sunflower seeds. The bread is moist and yummy!
I am wondering if I could replace eggs with other ingredient?
I have friends who are vegan and allergy to eggs.
